args.text:
Introduction

Trees are an essential component of Michigan's natural landscape, providing a wide range of environmental, social, and economic benefits. From improving air and water quality to supporting wildlife and enhancing property values, trees play a critical role in creating a sustainable and livable community. In this article, we will explore the many benefits of trees in Michigan, including their contributions to the environment, their impact on human health and well-being, and their economic importance.
